docs.abstract: Computer systems need to understand time, space and causality. Right now they don’t.
docs.snippet: Computer systems need to understand time, space and causality. Right now they don’t.
docs.lead_paragraph: Artificial intelligence has a trust problem. We are relying on A.I. more and more, but it hasn’t yet earned our confidence.

headline.main: How to Build Artificial Intelligence We Can Trust

byline.original: By Gary Marcus and Ernest Davis

docs.abstract: Investigations could eventually lead to the breakup of some companies, and to new laws that might alter the balance of corporate power.
docs.snippet: Investigations could eventually lead to the breakup of some companies, and to new laws that might alter the balance of corporate power.
docs.lead_paragraph: Investigations could eventually lead to the breakup of some companies, and to new laws that might alter the balance of corporate power.

headline.main: 16 Ways Facebook, Google, Apple and Amazon Are in Government Cross Hairs

docs.abstract: Lawmakers investigating Amazon, Apple, Facebook and Google for possible antitrust violations on Friday sent the companies detailed requests for information.
docs.snippet: Lawmakers investigating Amazon, Apple, Facebook and Google for possible antitrust violations on Friday sent the companies detailed requests for information.
docs.lead_paragraph: Congress showed the breadth of its investigation into the big tech companies on Friday, making a public demand for scores of documents, including the personal emails and other communications from dozens of top executives.

headline.main: House Antitrust Panel Seeks Documents From 4 Big Tech Firms
headline.print_headline: House Inquiry Targets Heads Of Tech Giants

docs.abstract: The Amazon series is the latest to use otherworldly animation to explore the aftermath of trauma.
docs.snippet: The Amazon series is the latest to use otherworldly animation to explore the aftermath of trauma.
docs.lead_paragraph: “Is this a dream?” Alma (Rosa Salazar) asks her father, Jacob (Bob Odenkirk), in the second episode of “Undone.”

headline.main: Review: In the Entrancing ‘Undone,’ Life Is but a Dream State

docs.abstract: Plus, WeWork takes steps to go public, and investigations into the Jeffrey Epstein case continue.
docs.snippet: Plus, WeWork takes steps to go public, and investigations into the Jeffrey Epstein case continue.
docs.lead_paragraph: It has been an eventful week for the stock market, and not in a good way. Catch up on the latest business here, and then head over to the Styles section, where we’re collecting your stories about the weird, awkward world of workplace culture. After all, nothing soothes economic fears quite like lighthearted office gossip.

headline.main: G.E. Is Accused of Major Fraud, and Stocks Take a Beating

docs.abstract: The superstar took her Savage x Fenty show to the Barclays Center for a night.

docs.lead_paragraph: On Tuesday night in Brooklyn, Rihanna made her bid for global underwear domination.

headline.main: Rihanna’s Spectacular Sexy Underpants Variety Hour

docs.abstract: Sharpies, auto emissions and the weaponization of policy.
docs.snippet: Sharpies, auto emissions and the weaponization of policy.
docs.lead_paragraph: Democracies used to collapse suddenly, with tanks rolling noisily toward the presidential palace. In the 21st century, however, the process is usually subtler.

docs.abstract: I have about 400 offers to buy illegal copies of my own work. Something is very wrong.
docs.snippet: I have about 400 offers to buy illegal copies of my own work. Something is very wrong.
docs.lead_paragraph: One day not long ago in a college class I was teaching, some of my students couldn’t find the page I was talking about in the reading. And it dawned on me: There was only one required text in the class, an anthology of writing about the natural world called “American Earth.” And they were reading pirated copies — versions downloaded free from some dubious “provider” on the internet.

headline.main: Steal This Book? There’s a Price
headline.print_headline: Steal This Book? There’s a Price

docs.abstract: Some critics of the industry want to see the businesses broken up. Others would like to strengthen regulation of Silicon Valley. And there are shades of gray.
docs.snippet: Some critics of the industry want to see the businesses broken up. Others would like to strengthen regulation of Silicon Valley. And there are shades of gray.
docs.lead_paragraph: The Justice Department is investigating them, as is the Federal Trade Commission. Congress and state attorneys general have their sights on the companies, too.

headline.main: How Should Big Tech Be Reined In? Here Are 4 Prominent Ideas
headline.print_headline: How to Rein In Big Tech? Here Are 4 Ideas, From Drastic to Modest

docs.abstract: Humans help train artificial intelligence, so someone may be listening to what you tell Siri, Google Assistant or Alexa. Here’s what to do if you have a problem with that.
docs.snippet: Humans help train artificial intelligence, so someone may be listening to what you tell Siri, Google Assistant or Alexa. Here’s what to do if you have a problem with that.
docs.lead_paragraph: Many of us ask the digital companions in our homes, whether it’s Amazon’s Alexa, Apple’s Siri or Google Assistant, to handle innocuous tasks like setting a timer and playing music.

headline.main: Hi, Alexa. How Do I Stop You From Listening In On Me?
headline.print_headline: Alexa, Please Stop Listening In on Me?
